âœ… Season: Rabi (Winter)

 âœ… Climate: Prefers cool temperatures (10-15Â°C) with moderate irrigation

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained loamy and alluvial soil

 âœ… Usage: Staple food used in chapati, bread, and bakery items

 âœ… Punjab Relevance: Punjab is the largest producer of wheat in India, known as the "Granary of India"

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (Oct-Nov): Deep plowing, apply 10-12 tons/ha FYM

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (Nov-Dec): Drilling method (4-5 cm depth, 20 cm row spacing). Seed rate: 100-125 kg/ha

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Dec-Feb): 100 kg N, 50 kg P, 50 kg K/ha before sowing; 40 kg N/ha after 30-40 days

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (Dec-Mar): 4-6 irrigations; Isoproturon (0.75 kg/ha) for weeds

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Rust, smut â€“ Mancozeb (2g/L water)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Mar-Apr): 120-140 days; golden grains indicate maturity. Yield: 3-5 tons/ha

âœ… Season: Kharif (Monsoon)

 âœ… Climate: Requires high rainfall (100-150 cm)

 âœ… Soil: Clayey and alluvial soil with good water retention

 âœ… Usage: Punjab is a major rice exporter; used for staple food

 âœ… Punjab Relevance: Key regions include Amritsar, Ludhiana, and Patiala

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (May-June): Leveling and puddling, apply 10-12 tons/ha FYM

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (June-July): Transplanting method (20 cm row spacing). Seed rate: 25-30 kg/ha

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (July-Sept): 60 kg N, 40 kg P, 40 kg K/ha before transplanting

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Oct): Continuous standing water. Pretilachlor (1 kg/ha) for weeds

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Blast, bacterial blight â€“ Mancozeb (2g/L)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Oct-Nov): 120-150 days. Yield: 4-6 tons/ha

âœ… Season: Kharif (Monsoon) & Rabi (Winter)

 âœ… Climate: Requires moderate rainfall (50-100 cm) with temperatures around 20-30Â°C

 âœ… Soil: Grows best in loamy and alluvial soil

 âœ… Usage: Used in food, fodder, starch, and oil production

 âœ… Punjab Relevance: Increasingly cultivated in Punjab due to water conservation efforts

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (May-June): Apply 10-12 tons/ha FYM

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (June-July & Oct-Nov): Drilling method (4-5 cm depth, 60 cm row spacing). Seed rate: 20-25 kg/ha

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (July-Sept): 120 kg N, 60 kg P, 40 kg K/ha before sowing

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Oct): 2-3 irrigations; Atrazine (0.5 kg/ha) for weeds

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Fall armyworm, rust â€“ Neem oil or Chlorpyrifos (2ml/L)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Oct-Nov & Feb-March): 90-120 days. Yield: 3-4 tons/ha

âœ… Season: Rabi (Winter)

 âœ… Climate: Grows well in cool, dry conditions (10-15Â°C)

 âœ… Soil: Prefers well-drained loamy soil

 âœ… Usage: Used in malt, brewing, and animal feed

 âœ… Punjab Relevance: Grown in dryland farming regions

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (Oct-Nov): Plow land, apply 10 tons/ha FYM

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (Nov-Dec): Drilling method (20 cm row spacing). Seed rate: 85-100 kg/ha

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Dec-Feb): 50 kg N, 40 kg P, 30 kg K/ha before sowing

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (Dec-Mar): 3-4 irrigations, Pendimethalin (1 kg/ha) for weeds

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Powdery mildew â€“ Sulfur spray (2g/L)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Mar-Apr): 110-130 days. Yield: 2.5-3.5 tons/ha

âœ… Season: Kharif (Monsoon)

 âœ… Climate: Drought-resistant, needs 40-60 cm rainfall

 âœ… Soil: Thrives in sandy loam soil

 âœ… Usage: Used in roti, fodder, and processed foods

 âœ… Punjab Relevance: Cultivated in low-rainfall zones of Punjab

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (May-June): Plowing, apply 8-10 tons/ha FYM

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (June-July): Broadcasting method (30 cm row spacing). Seed rate: 4-6 kg/ha

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (July-Aug): 40 kg N, 20 kg P, 20 kg K/ha before sowing

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Sept): Mostly rain-fed, one irrigation at booting stage. Atrazine (0.5 kg/ha) for weeds

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Downy mildew â€“ Mancozeb (2g/L)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Sept-Oct): 90-110 days. Yield: 1.5-2.5 tons/ha

âœ… Season: Rabi (Winter)

 âœ… Climate: Requires cool temperatures (20-25Â°C)

 âœ… Soil: Best in well-drained loamy or black cotton soil

 âœ… Usage: Used in dal, flour (besan), and various food products

 âœ… Punjab Relevance: Grown in semi-arid regions of Punjab

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (Oct-Nov): Deep plowing, apply 5-8 tons/ha FYM

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (Nov-Dec): Drilling method (3-4 cm depth, 30 cm row spacing). Seed rate: 75-100 kg/ha

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Dec-Jan): 20-30 kg N, 50 kg P, 30 kg K/ha before sowing

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (Dec-Feb): Rain-fed crop, but one irrigation at pod development boosts yield. Pendimethalin (1 kg/ha) for weeds

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Pod borer â€“ Neem oil or Spinosad (1ml/L)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Feb-March): 110-120 days. Yield: 1.5-2.5 tons/ha

âœ… Season: Winter (Nov-Feb)

 âœ… Climate: Subtropical (15-30Â°C)

 âœ… Soil: Sandy loam with good drainage

 âœ… Usage: Fresh fruit, juices, jams

 âœ… Punjab Relevance: Found in Fazilka, Hoshiarpur, Muktsar

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (March-April): Deep plowing, adding 15-20 tons/ha Farmyard Manure (FYM)

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (July-August): Budded plants at 6x6m spacing

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Aug-Dec): 500g Nitrogen, 250g Phosphorus, 500g Potassium per tree

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (Year-round): Drip irrigation, regular manual weeding

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Citrus canker â€“ Copper fungicide spray (3g/L)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Nov-Feb): Fruit ripens in 4-5 years, yield 30-35 tons/ha
ğŸˆ Guava \n (Allahabad Safeda, Punjab Pink, Lalit)

âœ… Season: Winter & Summer

 âœ… Climate: Semi-arid (20-35Â°C), rainfall 80-150 cm

 âœ… Soil: Sandy loam

 âœ… Usage: Fresh fruit, jams, juices

 âœ… Punjab Relevance: Cultivated in Ludhiana, Amritsar, Patiala

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (April-May): Plowing with 10-12 tons/ha FYM

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (June-July): 5x5m spacing, deep pits for seedlings

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (July-Dec): 400g N, 250g P, 500g K/tree

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Feb): Drip irrigation, manual weeding

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Fruit fly â€“ Malathion spray (2ml/L water)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Oct-April): 2-3 years after planting, yield 15-20 tons/ha

âœ… Season: Winter (Nov-Feb)

 âœ… Climate: Semi-arid, rainfall 50-100 cm

 âœ… Soil: Loamy soil, well-drained

 âœ… Usage: Used in Ayurvedic medicine, juices, candies

 âœ… Punjab Relevance: Found in Ropar, Patiala, Ludhiana

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (Feb-March): Deep plowing, applying 20 tons/ha FYM

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (April-May): 8x8m spacing, grafted saplings

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (May-Oct): 500g N, 250g P, 300g K/tree

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (May-Jan): Drip irrigation, mulching with dry leaves

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Bark-eating caterpillar â€“ Chlorpyrifos spray (3ml/L water)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Nov-Feb): 4-5 years after planting, yield 20-30 tons/ha
ğŸ Pear \n (Bartlett, Punjab Beauty, Punjab Soft)

âœ… Season: Summer (July-September)

 âœ… Climate: Temperate, rainfall 50-100 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained sandy loam

 âœ… Usage: Fresh consumption, canned products

 âœ… Punjab Relevance: Found in Pathankot, Gurdaspur, Hoshiarpur

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (Dec-Jan): Deep plowing, adding 20 tons/ha FYM

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (Jan-Feb): 5x5m spacing, grafted saplings

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Feb-June): 500g N, 300g P, 400g K/tree

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (Feb-Aug): Flood irrigation every 10-15 days

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Pear psylla â€“ Neem oil spray (5ml/L water)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (July-Sept): 3-4 years after planting, yield 20-25 tons/ha

âœ… Season: Year-round

 âœ… Climate: Arid, semi-arid (25-40Â°C), rainfall 50-100 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained sandy loam

 âœ… Usage: Fresh fruit, juices, medicinal use

 âœ… Punjab Relevance: Cultivated in Amritsar, Ferozepur, Tarn Taran

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (March-April): Deep plowing, applying 10-15 tons/ha FYM

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (May-June): 4x5m spacing, saplings transplanted

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (June-Oct): 600g N, 400g P, 500g K/tree

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (June-Dec): Drip irrigation, pruning for airflow

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Fruit cracking â€“ Boron spray (0.2%)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Aug-Nov): 2-3 years after planting, yield 12-15 tons/ha

âœ… Season: Winter & Summer

 âœ… Climate: Hot & dry, rainfall 30-60 cm

 âœ… Soil: Sandy loam

 âœ… Usage: Fresh consumption, pickles

 âœ… Punjab Relevance: Cultivated in Bathinda, Mansa, Faridkot

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (June-July): Apply 10-15 tons/ha FYM

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (July-August): 6x6m spacing, seedling transplantation

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Aug-Dec): 300g N, 200g P, 250g K/tree

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (Aug-March): Drip irrigation, mulching to conserve moisture

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Fruit borer â€“ Neem-based insecticides

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Nov-Feb): 2-3 years after planting, yield 15-18 tons/ha
ğŸ¥” Potato \n (Kufri Pukhraj, Kufri Jyoti, Kufri Sindhuri)

âœ… Season: Rabi (Winter)

 âœ… Climate: Cool weather (10-20Â°C), moderate rainfall 50-100 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained sandy loam with good organic matter

 âœ… Usage: Used for fresh consumption, chips, processed products

 âœ… Punjab Relevance: Cultivated in Jalandhar, Hoshiarpur, Ludhiana

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (Sept-Oct): Plowed 2-3 times, 20-25 tons/ha FYM applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (Oct-Nov): Spacing 60x20 cm, seed tubers planted

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Nov-Jan): 120 kg N, 80 kg P, 100 kg K/ha

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (Nov-Feb): 5-6 irrigations, earthing up done

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Late blight â€“ Mancozeb spray (2.5g/L water)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Feb-March): 90-100 days after planting, yield 25-30 tons/ha
ğŸ¥¦ Cauliflower \n (Pusa Snowball, Punjab Giant, Pusa Deepali)

âœ… Season: Rabi & Kharif

 âœ… Climate: Cool temperature (15-25Â°C), rainfall 50-80 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained loamy soil with good fertility

 âœ… Usage: Used in curries, pickles, processed foods

 âœ… Punjab Relevance: Found in Amritsar, Patiala, Gurdaspur

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (July-Aug): FYM 15-20 tons/ha applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (Aug-Sept): Spacing 45x45 cm, seedlings transplanted

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Aug-Dec): 100 kg N, 60 kg P, 80 kg K/ha

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (Aug-Jan): Drip irrigation, 2-3 manual weedings

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Diamondback moth â€“ Neem oil spray (5ml/L)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Nov-Jan): 90-110 days after transplanting, yield 20-25 tons/ha
ğŸ¥• Carrot \n (Pusa Rudhira, Nantes, Early Kunwari)

âœ… Season: Rabi (Winter)

 âœ… Climate: Cool climate (10-25Â°C), rainfall 40-80 cm

 âœ… Soil: Deep sandy loam, well-drained

 âœ… Usage: Used for fresh consumption, juices, sweets

 âœ… Punjab Relevance: Grown in Ludhiana, Moga, Ferozepur

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (Sept-Oct): Plowing and FYM 15-20 tons/ha applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (Oct-Nov): Spacing 30x10 cm, seeds sown at 1.5 cm depth

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Nov-Jan): 80 kg N, 50 kg P, 70 kg K/ha

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (Nov-Feb): 4-5 irrigations, manual weeding

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Aphids â€“ Neem oil spray (3ml/L water)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Feb-March): 90-100 days after sowing, yield 30-35 tons/ha

âœ… Season: Rabi (Winter)

 âœ… Climate: Cool weather (10-20Â°C), moderate rainfall 50-80 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained loamy soil with high organic matter

 âœ… Usage: Used in curries, frozen peas, processed products

 âœ… Punjab Relevance: Cultivated in Jalandhar, Ludhiana, Sangrur

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (Oct-Nov): Plowing 2-3 times, FYM 15-20 tons/ha applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (Nov-Dec): Spacing 30x10 cm, seeds sown at 3 cm depth

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Nov-Jan): 50 kg N, 60 kg P, 40 kg K/ha

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (Nov-Feb): 2-3 irrigations, manual weeding

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Powdery mildew â€“ Sulfur spray (2g/L water)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Feb-March): 90-100 days after sowing, yield 15-18 tons/ha
ğŸ¥¬ Spinach \n (All Green, Pusa Harit, Punjab Green)

âœ… Season: Rabi & Kharif

 âœ… Climate: Cool season crop (10-25Â°C), rainfall 40-80 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained sandy loam, rich in organic matter

 âœ… Usage: Used in curries, soups, fresh salads

 âœ… Punjab Relevance: Found in Ferozepur, Mansa, Hoshiarpur

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (Aug-Sept): FYM 10-15 tons/ha applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (Sept-Oct): Broadcasting seeds or 30x10 cm row spacing

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Oct-Dec): 40 kg N, 30 kg P, 20 kg K/ha

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (Oct-Feb): 3-4 irrigations, weeding at 30 days

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Leaf miner â€“ Neem oil spray (2ml/L water)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Nov-Feb): 30-40 days after sowing, yield 10-12 tons/ha
ğŸ¥• Radish \n (Pusa Chetki, Punjab Safed, Japanese White)

âœ… Season: Rabi & Kharif

 âœ… Climate: Cool temperature (10-25Â°C), rainfall 50-90 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained sandy loam with high organic matter

 âœ… Usage: Used in salads, curries, pickles

 âœ… Punjab Relevance: Grown in Ludhiana, Amritsar, Patiala

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (Aug-Sept): FYM 10-15 tons/ha applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (Sept-Oct): 30x10 cm row spacing, seeds sown at 2 cm depth

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Oct-Dec): 60 kg N, 40 kg P, 50 kg K/ha

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (Oct-Feb): 3-4 irrigations, manual weeding

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Aphids â€“ Neem oil spray (3ml/L water)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Nov-Feb): 40-50 days after sowing, yield 12-15 tons/ha
